CatDescriptText: Cutline of related images published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1953, pg. 11 reads: "Links' Cotton Parade Terrific Hit - One of the most enchanting evenings of song and fashion swept into Pittsburgh last Friday night [ at A. Leo Weil School], when the Pittsburgh Chapter of the Kinks, Inc., presented "Cotton of Parade," a combined musicale and summer style show, featuring Rose V. Murray of Houston, Tex., the 1953 "Spirit of Cotton Makers Jubilee."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of two women, including Rose V. Murray, wearing dress with light colored lace stripes around collar and waist, receiving corsage, on stage of A. Leo Weil school for Cotton on Parade fashion show
